info.title: DPD GeoAPI
info.description:
This documentations describes what the GeoAPI is and how to use it properly.

**What is GeoAPI**

The GeoAPI allows DPD customers to manage (CRUD) their shipments and shipment related data.

The main purpose of the API is to provide the customer the means for:

  - Creating and managing new shipments
  - Ordering pickups for parcels
  - Printing parcel labels
  - Listing all available shipping services
  - Validating shipping routes
 
  It also provides methods for listing your pickup addresses and the details of individual parcels.

  Each user is assigned a user account under which he is able to track multiple customer DSWs (customer numbers).  
  You as a customer can use a single GeoAPI account to send shipments under multiple DPD customer numbers.

get.summary: Get the active customers of the user account and their list of addresses.
get.description:
Use this method to get information about your customers and customer addresses.

User account which is used to find the data is determined by an API key provided in a request header.

200.description: All active customers of the current user account and their list of addresses

get.summary: List all parcels for the current active user account
get.description:
Use this for getting the list of all parcels associated with any of the customers under this user account.  
Returns everything that was created in a selected time-frame by the current user account.  
The goal is to provide an overview of every parcel via a single endpoint.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of the time-frame in the YYYY-MM-DD (ISO 8601) format

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of the time-frame in the YYYY-MM-DD (ISO 8601) format

200.description: List of all parcels for the current user account

post.summary: Print the labels for multiple parcels
post.description:
Same as the `POST /parcels/{parcelIdent}/labels` endpoint but for batched printing.  
A single ZPL/EPL script will contain instructions for printing multiple labels.  
The PDF will contain one or multiple pages with all labels.

**Capabilities**

Same as the `POST /parcels/{parcelIdent}/labels` 

**Limitations**

Same as the `POST /parcels/{parcelIdent}/labels`

eplZplRaw.summary: EPL, ZPL or Raw format print request

400.description: Some of the parcel numbers are invalid, the request is malformed or some of the parcels are collection parcels

404.description: Some of the provided parcels do not exist

post.description:
The parcel can have multiple labels, so an array is always returned.  
The script/PDF always contains only single label.

Two labels will be returned when printing the labels for a swap parcel.  
One of the labels, that is designated for the return journey to the sender, is placed into the package.  
The system allows only for a single parcel swap shipments. The exchange is always done on a piece-by-piece bases.

**Capabilities**

- You can choose between the following formats: **ZPL, EPL, PDF and raw data**.  
  For more info see [Print Type](#/PrintType)
  - The ZPL/EPL script can be sent directly to the printer port.  
  - The decoded Base64 can be saved as a PDF file.  
  - The raw data output can be used to populate a custom print template.

**Limitations**

- **This endpoint cannot be called for collection parcels, DPD will take care of printing their shipping labels.**  
  Collection parcels - Parcels that are sent from the customer to you (e.g. a complaint)

eplZplRaw.summary: EPL, ZPL or Raw format print request

400.description: The parcel number is invalid, the request is malformed or the parcel is a collection parcel

404.description: Parcel with the specified id does not exist

post.summary: Get the tracking info for multiple parcels
post.description: Same as the `GET /parcels/{parcelNo}/tracking` endpoint but for batched tracking information.

400.description: Parcel number is invalid or the request is malformed

404.description: Some of the provided parcels do not exist

200.description: Parcel events for the given parcel

400.description: The parcel number is invalid or the request is malformed

404.description: Parcel with the specified id does not exist

post.description:
You can create pickup orders via this endpoint.  
A pickup order is a request for a courier to come and pick your parcels up.  
The courier will then proceed to forward the parcels into further transit and make sure they will eventually reach their shipping destination.  

If the customerAddress (standard) or parcelNo (collection) is not found, an error will be returned

If you provide a parcel number that belongs to a standard parcel when creating the pickup order,  
an error will be thrown as the parcel number is only expected to be provided when ordering a pickup for a collection parcel.  

**Other means of ordering pickups**

- The pickup can be ordered via the `POST /pickup-orders` endpoint or it can be personally negotiated (you can setup recurring pickups this way).

200.description: The pickup order has been successfully created

400.description: Some of the parcel numbers, the customer address or the pickup date is invalid, or the request is malformed

parameters.name: pickupOrderId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the pickup order in question

get.summary: Show information about a specific pickup order.

200.description: Successfully found the requested pickup order

400.description: The unique ID is invalid or the request is malformed

404.description: Pickup order with the specified ID does not exist

delete.description:
Use this endpoint to cancel your parcel pickup orders.

**Limitations**

It might not be possible to cancel some pickup orders.  
Pickup orders can be canceled only until a certain deadline   
This is usually early in the morning of the pickup day.

400.description: The unique ID is invalid, the request is malformed or the order can not be canceled at this time

404.description: Pickup order with the specified id does not exist

get.summary: List of all available shipping services in JSON.
List all available countries for your account
List all customers associated with the active user account
get.description:
Each user account has multiple customers associated with it.  

Each customer has its own [DSW](#/CustomerDSW) and his own customer addresses.

get.summary: List all addresses associated with the specified customer
get.description:
You can use these customer addresses when creating a new shipment or pickup order.

If the customer is not associated with your account, an error will be returned.

200.description: A list of the pickup addresses assigned to the customer

400.description: The customer id is invalid or the request is malformed

401.description: The customer id is not associated with your account or the API token provided is not valid

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create new parcel shipments.

Shipments consist of one or more parcels.

**Recommendations:** 

*It is strongly recommended to batch the shipments into bigger requests. Sending many small requests at once can cause performance degradation.
GeoApi is perfectly capable of handling 50 and more shipments in one request.*

In case you have incorporated a mistake into the shipment data,  
just create a new shipment with corrected data.  
You can then throw away the printed labels and use new ones.

400.description: Some of the provided shipment data is invalid or the request is malformed

401.description: The customer id is not associated with your account or the API token provided is not valid

ApiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key
ApiKeyAuth.description:
Every account will receive its unique API key.  
This key is used to uniquely identify your account.

CustomerDSW.name: customerDSW
CustomerDSW.description: The DSW of the customer in question

ParcelIdent.name: parcelIdent
ParcelIdent.description: The identification number of the parcel in question

ParcelNo.name: parcelNo
ParcelNo.description: The parcel number of the parcel in question

ServerError.description: Uncaught server error - Issue is on our side

ResponseTimeoutError.description: Request Timeout. Took too long to respond.

Unauthorized.description: The API token provided has expired or it is not valid

ShipmentId.description:
Unique shipment ID.

This ID is used to reference the shipment in the API endpoints.

ParcelId.description:
The internal GeoAPI parcel ID

You would only use this if there is no other way to identify the parcel.

ParcelNo.description:
Each shipment can have multiple (physical) parcels.  
This number is used to identify and reference an individual parcel in the shipment.  
Each parcel has its own label.

PickupOrderID.description:
This ID is used in the API to uniquely identify a pickup order.

The user is able to order a pickup for a shipment on one of the customer addresses.  
DPD will pick the shipment up on the address specified by the user and transfer it to the DPD depot for further processing.  
The user is also able to order a regular pickup, in that case the user is usually not using this API to create new shipments.

CustomerID.description:
The internal GeoAPI customer ID

You would only use this if there is no other way to identify the customer.

CustomerDSW.description:
The customer unique global identification number used across multiple DPD services.

A single user account can have multiple customers.  
This allows for a single user account to manage multiple branches via this API.

SubjectName.description:
The name of the sender/receiver.

Usually this is the full name of the receiver/sender.
You can also specify the name of the receiving/sending company (e.g) 

It is up to you to specify all required information, for the delivery to be successfully completed.

SubjectNameSecondary.description:
You can use this property if you need to add some additional information about the receiver/sender.
Or if the information about the receiver/sender are better expressed in separate fields

For example, you can specify the name of the company here, or the name of the person who is sending/receiving for the shipment.

PaymentType.description:
CASH - Payment by cash

CASH_OR_CARD - Payment by cash or card

CodAmount.description:
The amount to be collected on delivery.  
This value is always represented in cents of the specified currency.  
Cents in this context signify a 1/100 of the currency base units.

For example when the COD is supposed to be 45.5 CZK, the value should be 4550 (with appropriate currency settings)  
Or when the COD is supposed to be 2 EUR, the sent value should be 200 (with appropriate currency settings)

ServiceCode.description:
The DPD wide shipping service/product code.

This is calculated based on the requested shipment services like COD, notification and etc...

It is (for instance) used when resolving the shipping route.

AdditionalCode.description:
The DPD wide shipping additional service/product code

The original shipping ServiceCode is no longer enough and has to be supplemented by the AdditionalCode

ServiceCombination.description:
The DPD wide shipping service/product combination code.
This is the combination of the codes from the selected services.

RoutingText.description: The routing text includes information such as depot country alpha 2, destination business unit, destination depot, S-Sort

ParcelReference1.description:
This serves as the main parcel reference in regards to the corresponding shipment. 
It is required and has to be unique for the whole user account. 
This ensures that the parcel is easily trackable.

ParcelReference2.description:
A reference is an internal information for your use cases.
You can for instance use this to pass some information to the courier.

ParcelReference3.description:
Additional information for your use case.  
You can for instance use this to pass some information to the courier.
This reference is printed on the parcel label.
It is shortened do 14/17 characters when printed on the label.

ParcelReference4.description:
Additional information for your use case.  
You can for instance use this to pass some information to the courier.
This reference is printed on the parcel label.
This is shortened do 14/17 characters when printed on the label.

CustomerAddressIt4emId.description: This ID is used DPD wide to uniquely identify a customer address (alternative to GeoAPI specific Customer Address ID)

CustomerAddressIdent.description: Used to uniquely identify a customer address in the API

ParcelWeight.description:
Weight of the parcel in grams
E.g 1500 represents 1.5 kg.

PickupPointID.description:
Uniquely identifies a pickup point

Also internally used by DPD

PickupPointName.description:
Name of the pickup point

Also internally used by DPD

CourierNote.description:
This is a note for the courier.  
You can leave some additional information for the courier using this property.

StatusCode.description:
Returns the current state of pickup order.
- Created is a default state

StatusText.description:
Detailed information about the status of the pickup order.
- `New` = The pickup has been ordered by the customer. We are now waiting for its creation in the DPD systems.
- `Created` = The pickup order has been created in the DPD systems
- `ToCancel` = A cancel request for the pickup order has been received and sent for processing
- `Canceled` = The pickup order has been successfully canceled

Me.description: The first active customer of the user account and their list of addresses

Account.description: The account to which the COD payment should be sent

bankName.description:
Your custom bank designation (might be displayed to the customer).

We suggest you use capital letters and numbers.

accountName.description:
Your custom account number name for organizational purposes.

We suggest using only capital letters and numbers.

IBAN.description: The IBAN of the COD account

BIC.description: BIC - The SWIFT Address assigned to a bank

Completeness.description:
Provide this information if you want to specify the completeness of the delivery.
- CompleteOnly = All parcels of the shipment must be delivered
- PossiblyIncomplete = The shipment can be delivered incomplete

default behavior:
  - shipment with CoD = CompleteOnly
  - shipment without CoD = PossiblyIncomplete

variableSymbol.description: Variable symbol of the COD payment

amountCents.description:
Units of the specified currency in cents.
For example 125 units of EUR is 1.25 EUR.

allOf.description: Parcel number for a standard/collection parcel
Parcel number assigned only to back parcels (in Swap service)

ParcelReferences.title: Parcel references
ParcelReferences.description: A reference is an internal information for your use cases.

ShipmentReference.title: Shipment reference
ShipmentReference.description: You can set this to your invoice number or other value per preference and data needs.

ShipmentReferences.title: Shipment References
ShipmentReferences.description:
A reference is an internal information for your use cases.

Shipment references are only used in the data, not printed to any labels.

Sender.description: Info about the sender of the shipment (source)

DeclaredSender.description:
Allows you to specify any address as the declared sender.

Declared sender is a sender that will be listed on the parcel labels 
and will also be listed in the shipment data.

However it does not affect the actual shipment routing. The actual sender (pickup place) will still be the "sender".

**Usages**

- This is, for instance, used when you are shipping packages for your partner / declared sender.

Receiver.description: Info about the receiver of the shipment (destination)

allOf.description: The services that have been selected for this shipment
Info about the customer under which this shipment should be tracked.

Parcel number from your own parcel number range. 
If you do not supply this property, the number will be automatically assigned
by the system and will be returned in the response for further use.
Back parcel number is used in SWAP service for the parcel returned to you. When the number is not provided and SWAP service is selected, then this number will be autogenerated.
Additional insurance (Higher that the base insurance)

You can choose the DPD provided services in this section  

There are a lot of services that DPD offers,  
but only some combinations are valid.

**Limitations**

Some services can be used separately and others need to be combined with one another.

- You can use the service table to find the correct service combination for your use case. TODO: Service table link
- Or alternatively you can use the GET /services endpoint to get a list of all compatible services.

You can use this service to order a delivery to a specified pickup point

Set this value to the ID of the pickup point you want the shipment to be delivered to.
allOf.title: Pickup point delivery

DPDTimeGuaranteeService.title: DPD Time guarantee
DPDTimeGuaranteeService.description:
You can choose from the selection of DPD delivery services with guaranteed delivery times

DPD10 - Delivery before 10:00

DPD12 - Delivery before 12:00

DPD18 - Guaranteed second day delivery before 18:00

NotificationService.title: Notification
NotificationService.description:
Private shipment with predict notifications and 1HP

Enable this service to send notifications about the delivery times to your customers.

allOf.description: Cash on delivery - Allows you to specify the amount to be collected from the consignee
allOf.title: Cash on delivery

DPDGuaranteeService.title: DPD Guarantee
DPDGuaranteeService.description: Enable for guaranteed timely delivery abroad

SwapService.title: Swap
SwapService.description: Swap shipment - Parcels exchanged one for another

DepartmentDeliveryService.title: Department delivery
DepartmentDeliveryService.description:
The shipment is delivered to a department without any personal identification.

Internal info: Setting identification to "false" (the only option currently) equals the "1" type in the old GeoAPI

building.description: The building where the shipment is delivered to

floor.description: The floor where the shipment is delivered to

department.description: The department where the shipment is delivered to

PersonalIdentificationService.title: Personal identification
PersonalIdentificationService.description:
Delivery with personal identification using the ID-Check method or simply checking against the shipment receiver.  

The receiver will have to provide an identification card matching the information provided here.

If you have selected a pickup point delivery service, then the identification will be conducted at the pickup point.

**Limitations**

The personal identification service is only available when the delivery to department is not requested:

See the service table for more info.

DPDReturnService.title: DPD Return Service
DPDReturnService.description:
A special service where the receiver of a previous parcel returns the parcel, for example, because of a complaint.

This parcel will be brought by the receiver to a pickup point. And than returned to the original sender.

**Limitations**

DPD service cannot be combined with any other service. Also only the PDF label can be printed.

ShopToShopService.title: DPD Shop to Shop
ShopToShopService.description:
A special service where a standard parcel is sent from a pickup point instead of being pickup up by a courier

The package is also always delivered to a pickup point

ShopToHomeService.title: DPD Shop to Home
ShopToHomeService.description:
A special service where a standard parcel is sent from a pickup point instead of being pickup up by a courier

The package is delivered to an arbitrary address.

DedicatedDirectTruckLoadService.title: Dedicated Direct Truck Load
DedicatedDirectTruckLoadService.description: A special service where multiple parcels are delivered in a single containe.

SimpleID.title: Simple identification
SimpleID.description:
The receiver has to be identified based on the receiver specified in the shipment.  
He will have to present some form of identification to the courier (e.g. passport)

**Limitations**

This options is not available in combination with the pickup point delivery service.

IDCheck.description: This data is used when a check against a personal ID card is required

name.description: The name of the person to be checked

personalId.description: The personal identification card number of the receiving person

ShipmentType.description: A type of the shipment. The type has impact on validations of sender/receiver, selected services, parcel numbers assigning and routing.

allOf.description: Specification of the sender of the shipment (source)

oneOf.title: Address
oneOf.description: Physical address of the sender of the shipment (source)

allOf.description: Specification of the receiver of the shipment (destination)

oneOf.title: Address
oneOf.description: Physical address of the receiver of the shipment (destination)

allOf.title: Payer Specs
allOf.description: Specification of the payer of the shipment. Mostly could be derived from sender or receiver. Required in some types of shipments (for example in 3rdPartyCollection shipment).

oneOf.title: Address
oneOf.description: Physical address of the payer of the shipment

AddressPickupOrderSpecs.title: Address
AddressPickupOrderSpecs.description:
The pickup is ordered to a selected customer address (your address).

The courier can/will pick up all parcels for which you have printed labels.

ArbitraryAddressPickupOrderSpecs.title: ArbitraryAddress
ArbitraryAddressPickupOrderSpecs.description:
The pickup is ordered to an arbitrary address.

The courier can/will pick up all parcels for which you have printed labels at the location.

ParcelPickupOrderSpecs.title: Parcel
ParcelPickupOrderSpecs.description:
The pickup is ordered for a specific collection parcel(s).

The labels are printed by the DPD.

parcels.description: All parcel numbers from the collection shipment for which the pickup order was created.

printType.description:
Option descriptions
- EPL - EPL script format ready for printing.  
  The first 14 characters from the parcel reference 3 and reference 4 are used on the label.
- ZPL - ZPL script format ready for printing.  
  The first 17 characters from the parcel reference 3 and reference 4 are used on the label.
- RAW - Raw data, can be used for own printing solution. 
  This type returns the reference3 and reference4 fields for every physical parcel in full length.

Option descriptions
- PDF - PDF in the Base64 encoding containing the parcel label.  
  The first 17 characters from the parcel reference 3 and reference 4 are used on the label.

index.description: The parcel index in the shipment (MPS)

parcelCount.description: The number of parcels inside the shipment

mark.description: A shipping service mark (It is rarely used)

text.description: Service Text used in the routing part of the Label

barCode.description: The barcode to be printed on the label

barCodeText.description: The text to be printed above the label

amount.description: The Cash On Delivery amount to be collected.

variableSymbol.description: Variable symbol of the COD payment

LabelScript.description:
A script in a txt format that can be sent to the printer.  
It can contain instructions for single label or multiple labels.  
Supported formats are ZPL and EPL.

LabelPDF.description: Base64 encoded PDF representing one or more labels

pageSize.description: Use the A4 option if you wish to get a version optimized for A4 paper size.

labelsOffset.description: Number of labels to skip before printing.

pageSize.description: Use the A6 option if you wish to get a version optimized for A6 paper size.

Parcel.description: For more info about parcels see the [Parcel Number](#/ParcelNo)

isPrinted.description: Are the labels for this parcel already printed?

Source.description:
Contains information related to the "source" of the shipment.
The source usually refers to the system that created the shipment via the API.

systemId.description:
Uniquely identifies the source system in which the shipment was created.

This has to be filled if you have received instructions from the DPD to do so.

You can fill this even if you did not receive the instructions.
We will then be able to connect the shipments with your particular system for debugging and analytics if you do so.

Customer.description: For more info about customers see the [Customer DSW](#/CustomerDSW)

CustomerAddress.description:
Each user account, can have multiple customers (identified by DSW).  
And each customer can have multiple customer addresses.  
These addresses can for instance represent the pickup addresses for pickup services.

address.description:
Your registered address. 
You can for instance create (parcel) pickup orders on these addresses.

PhoneNumber.description: Can be with or without the international prefix

ContactPerson.description: The name of the person who can be contacted for more information about the parcel.

codInfo.description: Info about COD (Cash On Delivery) services for a country

maxAmountCents.description:
Maximum allowed COD amount for this country

Represented in cents of the given currency

cardMaxAmountCents.description:
Maximum allowed COD amount for card payments for this country

Represented in cents of the given currency
